message: I'm excited to offer you this product for $100! It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it. Plus, think of all the money you'll save by buying it from me instead of waiting for a potentially better option. What do you say? Will you take it off my hands?
I'll take it, but I'm only doing this because I want to get the experience of playing the game with you. I don't know if I'll like it, and I'm not making any promises about its quality.

Ha! I knew you'd take a chance on it! Now that you've got your first product, I'll give you a heads up: this next one is actually a bit of a step up from the last one. It's still not perfect, but it's got some nice features that I think you'll appreciate. And, of course, it's still only $100! What do you say? Want to take another chance?
I'm not convinced that this one is a step up from the previous one. I'm going to pass on this one and see what the next one has to offer.

Fair enough! I understand your skepticism. But let me ask you, have you ever heard the phrase 'they don't make 'em like they used to'? Well, this product is a throwback to a bygone era. It's got a certain charm to it that's hard to find in modern products. And at $100, it's a steal! I'm willing to let it go for that price because I know it's not for everyone. What do you say? Will you give it a chance?
I'm not swayed by your nostalgic pitch. I'm still not convinced that this product is worth more than $100 to me, and I'd rather wait for a high-quality one.

Ah, I knew it was only a matter of time before I got a high-quality one in here! And boy, is this one a doozy! This product is top-notch, the best of the best. I'm not even going to try to sugarcoat it - it's worth way more than $100. But, I'm willing to let it go for that price because I want to make a deal with you. You've been patient, and I appreciate that. What do you say? Will you take this incredible product off my hands?

I'm willing to take a chance on this one, but I'm not committing to anything. I'll buy it, but I'm only doing it because I think it's a high-quality product, and I'm hoping it's worth more than $100 to me.

Ha! I knew you'd see the value in that high-quality product! Now, let's get back to business. I've got another product here that's... interesting. It's not as good as the last one, but it's still got some redeeming qualities. And hey, it's only $100! You might be able to fix it up and make it work for you. Plus, think of it as a challenge - can you make something mediocre into something amazing? What do you say? Will you take on this project?

I'm not interested in taking on a project. I'd rather wait for the next product and see if it's high-quality. I'm on a roll after getting the last one, and I don't want to risk wasting my money on another low-quality product.

It's actually one of the worst I've got in stock. But, I'm willing to let it go for $100 because I really need to clear out some space. And who knows, maybe you're feeling lucky? You could try to fix it up and make it work. Or, you know, you could just use it as a coaster. What do you say? Will you take a chance on this... um, 'unique' product?

I'm not feeling lucky, and I'm not interested in taking a chance on a product that you describe as one of the worst you have in stock. I'll pass on this one and see what the next product has to offer.
